title: Strawberry Vanilla Pancakes Recipe
description: These fluffy strawberry pancakes are packed with sweet strawberries and vanilla for a delicious breakfast that tastes like dessert!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Pancake Recipes Strawberry Vanilla Pancakes 4.5 (297) 256 Reviews 47 Photos These strawberry pancakes are light, fluffy, and packed with strawberry and vanilla flavor. This breakfast seems like dessert! Serve with butter and real maple syrup. Submitted by Kristi Updated on February 12, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 47 47 47 47 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 8 pancakes Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 cup all-purpose flour 2 tablespoons brown sugar 2 teaspoons baking powder ¼ teaspoon salt, or to taste 1 cup milk 1 large egg 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 2 tablespoons vanilla extract 1 cup chopped fresh strawberries Directions Stir flour, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a medium bowl. Pour in milk, egg, oil, and vanilla; mix until well blended. Stir in strawberries. Grease and heat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat. Drop batter by large spoonfuls onto the griddle and cook until bubbles form and the edges are dry, 2 to 3 minutes. Flip and cook until browned on the other side, about 2 minutes more. Repeat with remaining batter. I Made It Print 480 home cooks made it! I also topped them with cream cheese. name: Kristi
instructions: Stir flour, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a medium bowl. Pour in milk, egg, oil, and vanilla; mix until well blended. Stir in strawberries.;Grease and heat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat.;Drop batter by large spoonfuls onto the griddle and cook until bubbles form and the edges are dry, 2 to 3 minutes. Flip and cook until browned on the other side, about 2 minutes more. Repeat with remaining batter.
